intro: Dischidia torricellensis, commonly known as the climbing fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its fast-growing, vining habit. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a waxy coating. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. Dischidia torricellensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to climb.
